N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 20 §§ 3-2.5 - Use of dollar amounts in computing tax

State Regulations
(Tax Law, section 171(19))
(a) Any amount required to be included in a
report may be entered at the nearest whole dollar amount. This does not apply
to the items that must be taken into account in making the computations
necessary to determine such amount. For example, each sale must be taken into
account at its exact amount, including cents, in computing the amount to be
included in the franchise tax report. However, the total amount to be included
in the franchise tax report may be entered at the nearest whole dollar amount. A taxpayer may elect not to use whole dollar amounts by reporting all amounts
in full, including cents. (b) For
the purpose of the computation to the nearest dollar, a fractional part of a
dollar shall be disregarded unless it amounts to one-half dollar or more, in
which case the amount (determined without regard to the fractional part of a
dollar) shall be increased by one dollar. (1)
